Articles.Content:
All,

 I hate to complain in my very first post on the new forum, but I'm really dubious about this new rep system.

 Rep used to have a specific function on the old forum; it marked a respondent as particularly helpful and knowledgeable (or not). This was useful to newbies for judging the merit of proffered advice. If somebody with high rep offers advice, it was probable that the advice was sound.

 Now we get rep for anything that anybody "likes", which is pretty much meaningless. Are we sure this is the way we want to go?

 Sorry 'n thanks,

-Slashy
I agree. The rep seems so dumb now. I like the bars and the comments it gave when you moused over them.
Just now looking through the new forums, I see what you mean by this. The 'Like this' reminds me of Facebook. That of course brings up an age-old Facebook issue about a 'Dislike this' button. lol

I agree.  Not entirely opposed to the likes, but , likes are cheap, rep was a bit more solid seeming, and a bit more interesting imho. I also liked those shiny green badge things. We got to get more of them than these circles. 

Rep took a bit more to get than the common like or upvote.

Then again, we have yet to fully see it in action.

But rep was cool, if they could make it a little more like the old one, that would be great.
IPS does not really place the emphasis that vBulletin did on reputation - sorry.

Sometimes rep is useful. Sometimes it's simply a measure of someones ability to regurgitate popular opinion.

And I like it when I get a notification when someone replies while I'm typing. No more ninja's.
IPS doesn't place a lot of emphasis on anything that vBulletin did.  And that's not a good thing.
I have 3 bars now, but have 185 points.  What?
New forums are nice, but maybe Kasper can change it from 'Like This' to Add Reputation?
Does anyone know that the black dots below our names represent? I have 5 of em and I don't know why.

44 minutes ago, legoclone09 said:

New forums are nice, but maybe Kasper can change it from 'Like This' to Add Reputation?

That's a good idea and might solve the issue GoSlash27 was pointing out. However, something tells me this 'button' is not just a simple add-in to the forums software, and changing it will likely require going in and editing the IPS code ... such as I once had to do with phpBB, which was possible but a serious pain in the neck to do.

So is our reputation now just the total number of 'likes' for our posts? Wow. Unlike. But just as with anything else, I'm sure we'll get used to it. The important thing is that we share good content with each other. Hopefully that would happen regardless of whatever version of fake internet points the system allows us to award each other
Kasper sid on the IRC you can write a plugin to do it, if one of us did it we could do it. It would be best for the modders to do, though.

Another thing about the older system that I liked is that rep was weighted, so that the more rep you had, the more rep would go to the person you gave rep to. Now it seems that every like is equal, with no weighting, is this true or are my speculations misplaced?

7 minutes ago, Robotengineer said:

Another thing about the older system that I liked is that rep was weighted, so that the more rep you had, the more rep would go to the person you gave rep to. Now it seems that every like is equal, with no weighting, is this true or are my speculations misplaced?

The weight wasn't significant. One only had to be on the forums for a few months or have like 50 rep to have it maxed out at 5. I only get less than 5 points of rep given to me once or twice. 

It's interesting that in this system, which has a less detailed reputation system that it rates your rep in your profile. You and I both have 'Excellent' reputation. You have 800 more points than I, there are so many lurkers.

Edited November 29, 2015 by NFUN
Is there a way to prevent it from showing your name on things you've 'liked'.  Because if not, I will be giving no more reputation, ever.

10 hours ago, legoclone09 said:

New forums are nice, but maybe Kasper can change it from 'Like This' to Add Reputation?

I'm not quite sure how possible that is.
He said a plugin has to be written, away to the modders!

One word: "dislike".

I have always, and always will, avoid any button with the word "like" on it.
It makes rep so much cheaper to give so it becomes pretty much meaningless.

20 hours ago, GoSlash27 said:

Rep used to have a specific function on the old forum; it marked a respondent as particularly helpful and knowledgeable (or not). This was useful to newbies for judging the merit of proffered advice. If somebody with high rep offers advice, it was probable that the advice was sound.

 Now we get rep for anything that anybody "likes", which is pretty much meaningless. Are we sure this is the way we want to go?

I hate to burst your bubble, but reputation never worked the way you describe. People rep for all sorts of things: Helpful advice, good mods, interesting craft, nice screenshots, fanworks, critiquing Squad, cracking jokes, etc. It has never been a useful measure of helpfulness or knowledgability.

1 hour ago, Frozen_Heart said:

It makes rep so much cheaper to give so it becomes pretty much meaningless.

Cheaper how?

1 hour ago, Red Iron Crown said:

I hate to burst your bubble, but reputation never worked the way you describe. People rep for all sorts of things: Helpful advice, good mods, interesting craft, nice screenshots, fanworks, critiquing Squad, cracking jokes, etc. It has never been a useful measure of helpfulness or knowledgability.

Cheaper how? 

Is there a way to put reputation power back up to 5? If our pre-migration rep count is presevered, rep power should be preserved too. It's not like I've been repped 1079 times, I've been repped about a fifth of that many times or less. It should either be the number or reps (I refuse to say "Like") we receive or a total of reps given * reputation power. Not a hybrid. I think.
